messageBody:
Chad Woolley wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am trying to use DirectorySuiteBuilder from junit-addons to avoid
> hardcoding
> my test class names in my suite. I would like to be able make this suite
> portable. In other words, I'd like be able to run it in an IDE, or to
> run it
> from Ant/Maven, and want to be able to run it even if the project is
> installed
> in a different directory on a different machine.
>
> Since DirectorySuiteBuilder wants to have an path or File to start
> recursing on,
> I'm not sure how to do this.
>
> I could probably make the user define MYPROJECT_HOME and hardcode the
> root of my
> project, then write some code to look this up and base the
> DirectorySuiteBuilder
> path on this. However, I'd like to avoid that if I could.

The problem is "what's the current working directory when I run JUnit?"
Just set it to be the same in every environment. I usually put
buildfiles in the root of the project tree, so that works out well for
me: in Ant I set the cwd to ${basedir}. In Eclipse, the default
configuration is to run the JVM with cwd set to the root of the current
project.

The only alternative that comes to mind is passing in a JVM property.
